text: Enables you to quickly send Geometry to Houdini and back.  Any Questions, recommendations or bugs, email Oliver Hotz @ oliver@heimlich.net.

The Substance Painter exchange requires UV Mapped geometry.  The geometry is sent to Substance Painter, which you can then texture and after export (PBR Roughness) you can automatically bring in and setup the Material in Houdini.
Takes the input geometry, launches Substance Painter and loads the object.  It is important to you have UV’s setup first.
Once the textures are baked out via
in Substance Painter (Choose PBR Roughness Preset on export), the images are then loaded in, and a material is setup.
Creates a UV via Labs AutoUV Node.
Set one texture set per UDIM Tile
Creates a texture set per UDIM Tile.  If an object was sent to Painter with UDIMS, when you update from painter afterwards, please make sure the toggle is set correctly.
Color per connected piece for ID map
Allows you to use the vertex color mode in the Bake textures dialog for ID Maps.  With this, you can then easily mask individual pieces.
Automatically adjust paths base on name change
Automatically sets up the texture and substance project paths based on the name.

The name of your object, which can be used to uniquely identify it.  This is important in case you save multiple maps into the same directory.  The name is automatically added to the export path, so you’ll have a subdirectory per identifier.
The path in which the images will be saved to from Substance Painter.  This path is automatically passed on to Substance Painter so that when you export textures, you do not have to specify it again.
Either an existing or new Substance project will be opened/created that at any time, you can go back to in Substance Painter.  Make sure hit
Specifies which renderer the material will be setup for.  Prompt is the default and will ask you at the time of import.
The image extension of the type of images saved from Substance Painter (by default
Defines whether you want to specify the material assignment at Object Level or Sop Level.  Sop level is beneficial when you have multiple
with different materials within a obj level.
Creates the materials in /mat instead of sop level material network.
The full path to the Substance Painter executable
If any of the token strings can be found in the filename, it will identify them as a basecolor/diffuse map.
If any of the token strings can be found in the filename, it will identify them as a roughness map.
If any of the token strings can be found in the filename, it will identify them as a normal map.
If any of the token strings can be found in the filename, it will identify them as a displacement map.
If any of the token strings can be found in the filename, it will identify them as a bump map.
If any of the token strings can be found in the filename, it will identify them as a emission map.
If any of the token strings can be found in the filename, it will identify them as a opacity map.
If any of the token strings can be found in the filename, it will identify them as a specular map.
If any of the token strings can be found in the filename, it will identify them as a metallic map.
If any of the token strings can be found in the filename, it will identify them as a ambient occlusion map.

You can bake additional maps such as ID and curvature in Substance Painter.  This is extemely useful especially for ID Maps.  This tool will automatically
    create groups for all connected geometry, and you can easily separate those by baking the ID map within substance painter.  To bake the ID Map in substance painter, make sure you use the MeshID/Polygroup Option.
.Tif and .Exr image files are brought in with a gamma set to 1.0 as linear files.  Outside of this, normal map images are also brought in at gamme 1.0.

title: OD Substance Painter Exchange
summary: Enables you to quickly send Geometry to Houdini and back.  Any Questions, recommendations or bugs, email Oliver Hotz @ oliver@heimlich.net.
